verses.verse: The head priest said, "If this is how he has these things, then..."
But Stephen was declaring, "Men, brothers and fathers, listen. The God of the magnificence was seen by our father Abraham as he was in Mesopotamia before the time for him to even reside in Haran.
And He said to him, 'Come out from your land and from your relatives, and come here into the land that I will show you.'
Then after he went out from the land of the Chaldeans, he resided in Haran. And from there, after the time for his father to die, He relocated him to this land in which you now reside.
And He did not give him an inheritance in it, not even a step of a foot. And He promised to give it to him for a permanent possession and to his seed after him (a child not being with him).
God spoke like this: that his seed will be a local foreigner in land belonging to others, and they will enslave and do bad to it for four hundred years.
'And the nation in which they will be slaves, I will judge,' said God. 'And after these things, they will come out and minister to Me in this place.'

And He gave him a treaty of circumcision. And this is how he had a son, Isaac, and circumcised him on the day, the eighth day, Isaac did the same to Jacob, and Jacob did the same to the twelve head fathers.
And when the head fathers were impassioned about Joseph, they gave him away to Egypt, and God was with him.
And He took him out of all his hard times and gave him generosity and insight directly in front of Pharaoh, a king of Egypt. And He put him in charge, being a leader over Egypt and his whole house.
But a famine came over all of the land of Egypt and Canaan and very hard times. And our fathers were not finding forage for their cattle.
When Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent our fathers off first.
And during the second time, Joseph was made known again to his brothers, and the family of Joseph became shown to Pharaoh.
When Joseph sent people out, he summoned Jacob (his father) and all of his relatives (in souls, seventy-five).
Jacob walked down to Egypt. And he and our fathers passed away,
and they were transferred to Shechem and placed in the grave that Abraham procured with a price of silver from the side of the sons of Emmor of Shechem.
Just as the time of the promise was coming near that God guaranteed to Abraham, the ethnic group grew and increased in Egypt
till a time that a different king stood up over Egypt who did not know Joseph.
After this king swindled our family, he did bad to our fathers, of the 'to be making their babies to be put out' kind for the 'to not survive' part,
in which time, Moses was born and to God he was well behaved, who was raised three months in the house of his father.
When he was placed outside, the daughter of Pharaoh took him up and raised him herself for a son.
And Moses was disciplined in every insight of Egyptians. He was competent in messages and in actions.
As a forty-year-time was being accomplished with him, it stepped up on his heart to keep an eye on his brothers, the sons of Israel.
And when he saw someone being wronged, he fended for him and made a retaliation against the Egyptian oppressing him when he struck the Egyptian.
He was assuming for his brothers to be understanding that God through his hand is giving a rescue to them, but the men did not understand.
On the following day, he was seen by them as they were arguing, and he urged them together for peace, saying, 'Men, you are brothers. Why are you doing wrong to each other?'
The man doing wrong to the man nearby pushed him away, saying, 'Who put you in charge as a head person and arbitrator over us?
You don't want to execute me the way that you executed the Egyptian yesterday, do you?'
Moses escaped during this saying and became a local foreigner in the land of Midian where he had two sons.
And when forty years were accomplished, there was seen by him in the backcountry of Mount Sinai, an angel of the Master in a blaze of fire of a bush.
When Moses saw it, he was amazed at the sighting. As he went forward to take a closer look, there became the Master's voice toward him.
'I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.' After there became trembling inside, Moses was not daring to take a closer look.
The Master said to him, 'Release the sandals of your feet. You see, the place in which you have stood is sacred ground.

When I looked, I saw the bad treatment of my ethnic group, the one in Egypt. And I listened to their groaning and stepped down to take them out of Egypt. And now, come here. I will send you out on a mission to Egypt.'

This Moses, whom they denied when they said, 'Who put you in charge as a head person and arbitrator?' this man, God sent out on a mission to be a head person and provider of their release in the hand of the angel who was seen by him in the bush.
This man led them out after he did miracles and indicators in the land of Egypt, in the Red Sea, and in the backcountry for forty years.
This man is Moses, the one who said to the sons of Israel, 'The Master, your God, will stand up a preacher to you from your brothers, as me. You will listen to him.'
This is the one who became in the assembly in the backcountry with the angel (the one speaking to him in Mount Sinai) and our fathers, who accepted living utterances to give to us,
to whom our fathers didn't want to become obedient, but pushed away and turned back in their hearts to Egypt
when they said to Aaron, 'Make gods for us that will travel ahead of us. You see, this Moses who led us out from Egypt land, we don't know what happened to him.'
And they made a calf in those days, led a sacrifice up to the idol, and were celebrating in the works of their hands.

God turned and gave them up to be ministering to the army of the sky, just as it has been written in a scroll of the preachers, (in Amos 5:25-27) 'You didn't offer slaughtered animals and sacrifices up to Me forty years in the backcountry, house of Israel, did you?
You even took up the tent of Molech and the constellation of your god, Remphan, the examples that you made to be bowing down to them. And I will relocate you on that side of Babylon.'
The tent of the witness was with our fathers in the backcountry, just as the One speaking to Moses specifically arranged for it to be made in line with the example that he had seen,
that our fathers also led in (after accepting it in succession) with Joshua in the permanent possession of the nations that God pushed out away from the face of our fathers until the days of David,
who found generosity in the sight of God and asked to find a shelter for the God of Jacob.
Solomon built Him a house.
But the Highest One does not reside in handmade temples, just as the preacher says, (in Isaiah 66:1)
'The sky is a throne to Me. The earth is a footrest of My feet. What kind of house will you build Me, says the Master? Or what place is My resting place?
Didn't My hand make all these?'
Stiffnecked and uncircumcised in the heart and the ears, you always fall opposing the Spirit, the Sacred Spirit. As your fathers did, you also do.

Which of the preachers did your fathers not persecute? They even killed the people who previously proclaimed about the coming of the Man who did what is right, of whom now you have become traitors and murderers,
some who received the law for placements of announcers and didn't observe it."
Hearing these things, they were being sawed in two by their hearts and were grinding their teeth at him.
Being full of the Sacred Spirit, when he stared into the sky, he saw God's magnificence and Jesus who had stood at places to the right of God.
And he said, "Look, I see the heavens that have been opened and the Son of the Person who has been standing at places to the right of God."
When they yelled with a loud voice, they held their ears and unanimously rushed on him.
And after throwing him outside of the city, they were throwing stones at him. And the witnesses put away their robes beside the feet of a young man called Saul.
And they were throwing stones at Stephen as he called over and said, "Master, Jesus, accept my spirit."
After placing his knees on the ground, he yelled with a loud voice, "Master, you shouldn't stack up this sin to them." And when he said this, he fell asleep.
